a thick, sweet, colourless liquid that has many industrial and medical uses, for example to make food taste sweet and in treatments for the skin: Cough syrups containing glycerol, honey and lemon are safe for children. The process of soap making yields glycerol and the salts of fatty acids (soaps). Synonym
glycerine
More examplesFewer examplesFrozen blood can be stored; the blood is mixed with glycerol, which prevents formation of ice crystals.Glycerine, also known as glycerol and glycerin, is used in some cake icings to improve consistency and is available from chemists and supermarkets.There was no observable advantage to adding glycerol to the formulation, probably because glycerol is transparent to UVC wavelengths. In triglycerides a glycerol molecule (C3H8O3) combines with three fatty acids.
